metadata.Title: CVE-2015-9253 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in PHP 7.3.x before 7.3.0alpha3, 7.2.x before 7.2.8, and before 7.1.20. The php-fpm master process restarts a child process in an endless loop when using program execution functions (e.g., passthru, exec, shell_exec, or system) with a non-blocking STDIN stream, causing this master process to consume 100% of the CPU, and consume disk space with a large volume of error logs, as demonstrated by an attack by a customer of a shared-hosting facility.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-9253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.2 - 7.2.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libphp7.2-embed - 7.2.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
php7.2 - 7.2.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
php7.2-bcmath - 7.2.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

notes.Note: leosilva> in 7.0 upstream patch caused a regression according with upstream that is the possible the missing patch: https://github.com/php/php-src/commit/cc5c51e7f0732067f105d13c6d355fcab5965c2f rodrigo-zaiden> php7.0 for xenial was released with above patch.

criterions.comment: php7.2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.2.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
